result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony L. Perkins

records.addlTxt:
(22CF279, 22CF368, 22CM163 are called at 11:32 AM) Defendant Anthony L. Perkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Anthony L. Perkins.  Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant indicates he has not taken any of his medications while incarcerated. Defendant states it does not affect his ability to move forward today. Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF279 Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in including 22CF368, 22CM163, 22TR1455. 
Court withholds sentence and orders years Probation with the following conditions: 90 days jail without Huber, all stayed pending further order of the court; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Maintain absolute sobriety; Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any recommendation; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders 2 days jail credit, if revoked.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:35 AM cases 22CM163, 22CF368, 22CF279 called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony L. Perkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Anthony L. Perkins. 
In felony files 22CF279 and 22CF368: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waivers. All cases are referred for ARGN (possible plea).

RETURN TO SENDER.
Time To Pay Summary, AODA Order, 1/2 Price IID Order and additional OWI paperwork.

RETURN TO SENDER.
Notice of Hearing and Notice of Assignment of Judge.

RETURN TO SENDER: Not Deliverable as Addressed.
Reminder Notice.

(Case called at 11:07 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Anthony Perkins appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Trenton Piltz appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 04/06/2022 at 1:30 PM.  Hearing: 04/07/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions: 
No contact with Walmart. 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
